Description: Eight joining fragments (ten with 1888,0601.654a) of lower part of Aeolian bucchero grey ware pottery fenestrated stand. Base flaring with triple moulding; three near vertical legs, with ribs at centre and sides, terminating in pseudo-lion's paws. One polished exterior; partly fired light brown.
Curator's comments: Originally published by Winifred Lamb, 1932, pl. 1,3, and subsequently dismantled into sets of sherds and mistakenly taken to be from Al Mina. British Museum 1888,0601.645a joins and 645b also belongs.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.180)
